definition[0]: ready to do something or deal with a situation
example[0]: There was no news and we were prepared for the worst (=expected something very bad).
example[1]: Luckily, we were well prepared for the storm.
example[2]: The country was ill-prepared to fight another war.
example[3]: I wasnâ€™t prepared for all their questions.
definition[1]: planned, made, or written at an earlier time, so that it is ready when it is needed
example[4]: The president read out a prepared statement.
